text: A related (and funny) talk by Gary Bernhardt 'The Birth and Death of Javascript' mentions VM based protection instead of kernel/hardware based: <https://www.destroyallsoftware.com/talks/the-birth-and-death-of-javascript>

text: An interesting stinger in the talk is that Gary argues that JS’s badness+ubiquity motivates the creation of the WASM abstraction layer, which is perhaps a better overall outcome (in terms of supporting a broader range of development options)

text: <!channel> Just started a new <#CE1R695T7|of-graphics> channel for folks interested in talking about new languages and, er, graphics. Caveat I'm coming from a fine arts background and haven't fully developed a vocabulary for this yet--but I'm thinking a couple recent developments (realtime raytracing, 6DoF controllers, depth-aware ML) make this an interesting moment to think experimentally.

channel for folks interested in talking about new languages and, er, graphics. text:
Ohh, :man-facepalming:. The image you gave is the image I should be running with. I downloaded it, but when I opened PharoLauncher I assumed I need to do more to 'install Pharo', before I can 'install GT'.

I think I was partly trying to acclimate on Pharo by itself before I added another layer on top. But I'll try the GT image this evening.

I'm on Mac OS. (I said that above, but it probably got lost among everything else..)
